result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael James Hobbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 219 DAYS time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges by 10/19/2024. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 10/20/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.
*-Court orders restitution in the amounts of $300 payable to Walgreens and $200 payable to Family Dollar. To be paid by 10/19/2023.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael James Hobbs

defendant.name: Hobbs, Michael James
defendant.address: 4821 West National Avenue, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael James Hobbs in court, in custody.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Michael James Hobbs.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin.Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 219 DAYS time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

*-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges by 10/19/2024. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*-Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
*-Court orders restitution in the amounts of $300 payable to Walgreens and $200 payable to Family Dollar. To be paid by 10/19/2023.

*-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 10/20/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
*-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

*APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Michael James Hobbs not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Michael James Hobbs.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Discussion held. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Maryann Corea in court on behalf of  Sam Obscherning, defendant Michael James Hobbs not in court, in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Discussion held regarding defendant's felony case. State sent a stand alone offer to Defense. Defense requests time to review offer.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court, defendant Michael James Hobbs not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court waives defendant's appearance for today's proceedings. 
Case in court for status. Case already authroized to transfer to Judge Kies. Defense requests another status to allow Judge Kies to accept the case. 
Case adjourned back to Br 30. 
  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court, defendant Michael James Hobbs not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel still needs offer.  Court will allow transfer of this case for global resolution.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Family Dollar and Walgreens.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Michael James Hobbs in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Michael James Hobbs in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael James Hobbs appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
